alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 5:11PM EST until January 03 at 9:01AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Louisville KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky... Elkhorn Creek Near Peaks Mill affecting Franklin County. .Continued rainfall will cause the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Elkhorn Creek Near Peaks Mill. * WHEN...Until late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Stillhouse Hollow Road floods. At 11.0 feet, Schoolhouse Road floods. At 12.0 feet, North Scruggs Lane floods near Elkhorn Campground. At 13.0 feet, Switzer (County 1689) and Indian Gap Roads flood. Goshen Road floods at back entrance to Two Creeks subdivision. At 14.0 feet, Jones Lane floods. Water approaches Georgetown Road (US 460). At 15.0 feet, Georgetown Road (US 460) floods in village of Forks of Elkhorn. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM EST Saturday the stage was 6.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 13.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued after forecast updates.
